examples.sentence: Counter System Basics - How counters work
本 as noun - Book (different from counter)

sections.heading: What is 本 (ほん/ぼん/ぽん)?
sections.content:
本 is the counter for long, cylindrical objects. It has three pronunciations (ほん、ぼん、ぽん) that change depending on the number it follows.

ペンを3本買いました "I bought 3 pens" ビールを2本ください "2 bottles of beer, please"

sections.heading: Complete 本 Counter Chart
sections.content: | Number | Reading | Romaji | Sound Change | | ------ | ---------- | -------- | ------------ | | 1 | いっぽん | ippon | ぽん | | 2 | にほん | nihon | ほん | | 3 | さんぼん | san-bon | ぼん | | 4 | よんほん | yon-hon | ほん | | 5 | ごほん | go-hon | ほん | | 6 | ろっぽん | roppon | ぽん | | 7 | ななほん | nana-hon | ほん | | 8 | はっぽん | happon | ぽん | | 9 | きゅうほん | kyuu-hon | ほん | | 10 | じゅっぽん | juppon | ぽん |

children.heading: Larger Numbers
children.content: 11本 = じゅういっぽん 20本 = にじゅっぽん 30本 = さんじゅっぽん 100本 = ひゃっぽん

children.heading: ほん (hon) - Default
children.content: 2本 (にほん) 4本 (よんほん) 5本 (ごほん) 7本 (ななほん) 9本 (きゅうほん)

children.heading: ぼん (bon) - After ん sound
children.content: 3本 (さんぼん) - after さん

children.heading: ぽん (pon) - After っ sound
children.content:
1本 (いっぽん) - いち becomes いっ 6本 (ろっぽん) - ろく becomes ろっ 8本 (はっぽん) - はち becomes はっ 10本 (じゅっぽん) - じゅう becomes じゅっ

Memory Tip: When a number ends with っ or ん, the counter sound changes!

children.heading: Writing Instruments
children.content:
ペン - pens 鉛筆 (えんぴつ) - pencils ボールペン - ballpoint pens マーカー - markers 筆 (ふで) - brushes

ペンを3本持っています "I have 3 pens" 鉛筆を5本買いました "I bought 5 pencils"

children.heading: Bottles and Cans
children.content:
ビール - beer bottles ワイン - wine bottles ジュース - juice bottles/cans ペットボトル - plastic bottles 缶 (かん) - cans

ビールを2本ください "2 beers, please" 水を1本買いました "I bought 1 bottle of water"

children.heading: Trees and Plants
children.content:
木 (き) - trees 花 (はな) - flowers (with long stems) バラ - roses

庭に木が10本あります "There are 10 trees in the garden" バラを3本もらいました "I received 3 roses"

children.heading: Long Vegetables
children.content:
きゅうり - cucumbers 大根 (だいこん) - daikon radishes にんじん - carrots バナナ - bananas

バナナを5本食べました "I ate 5 bananas" きゅうりを2本使います "I'll use 2 cucumbers"

children.heading: Sports Equipment
children.content:
バット - baseball bats ラケット - rackets ゴルフクラブ - golf clubs 釣り竿 (つりざお) - fishing rods

バットを2本持っています "I have 2 bats"

children.heading: Umbrellas
children.content:
傘 (かさ) - umbrellas

傘を1本忘れました "I forgot 1 umbrella"

children.heading: Films/Videos
children.content:
映画 (えいが) - films/movies ビデオ - videos

映画を3本見ました "I watched 3 films"

children.heading: Long Items in General
children.content: ひも - strings/ropes 棒 (ぼう) - sticks/poles パイプ - pipes レール - rails

children.heading: 何本 (なんぼん)
children.content: 何本ありますか？ "How many are there?" 何本買いますか？ "How many will you buy?" ペンが何本必要ですか？ "How many pens do you need?" 木が何本植えてありますか？ "How many trees are planted?"

children.heading: Object + を + 本 Counter
children.content: ペンを3本買った "I bought 3 pens" ビールを2本飲んだ "I drank 2 beers" 映画を5本見た "I watched 5 movies"

children.heading: Subject + が + 本 Counter + Verb
children.content: 木が10本あります "There are 10 trees" ペンが3本ありません "There aren't 3 pens"

children.heading: 本 Counter + の + Noun
children.content: 3本のペン "3 pens" 2本のビール "2 beers" 5本の木 "5 trees"

children.heading: Example 1: Stationery Store
children.content: A: ペンを何本買いますか？ "How many pens will you buy?" B: 5本ください "5, please" A: 色は？ "What colors?" B: 黒を3本と赤を2本 "3 black and 2 red"

children.heading: Example 2: Convenience Store
children.content: A: お飲み物は？ "Drinks?" B: ビールを2本ください "2 beers, please" A: 冷たいのと常温、どちらがよろしいですか？ "Cold or room temperature?" B: 冷たいのでお願いします "Cold, please"

children.heading: Example 3: Flower Shop
children.content: A: バラは何本入りますか？ "How many roses do you want?" B: 12本でお願いします "12, please" A: かしこまりました "Certainly"

children.heading: Example 4: Movies
children.content: A: 週末に映画を何本見ましたか？ "How many movies did you watch this weekend?" B: 3本見ました "I watched 3" A: すごいですね！ "That's amazing!"

children.heading: 〜本ずつ (each/apiece)
children.content: 一本ずつ取ってください "Please take one each" 2本ずつ配ります "I'll distribute 2 each"

children.heading: 〜本目 (ordinal)
children.content: 1本目 (いっぽんめ) - the first one 2本目 (にほんめ) - the second one 3本目 (さんぼんめ) - the third one 3本目の映画が一番面白かった "The third movie was the most interesting"

children.heading: 〜本も (as many as)
children.content: 10本も飲んだ "I drank as many as 10" 5本も買った "I bought as many as 5"

children.heading: 〜本しか (only)
children.content: 1本しかない "There's only 1" 2本しか持っていない "I only have 2"

children.heading: Don't use for:
children.content:
Short cylindrical objects:

Wrong: 電池3本 ❌ Right: 電池3個 ✓ "3 batteries"

Books (despite 本 meaning "book"):

Wrong: 本3本 ❌ Right: 本3冊 (さんさつ) ✓ "3 books"

Thick/bulky cylinders:

logs, tree trunks → might use 個 instead

children.heading: Common Mistakes
children.content: Wrong: さんほん (3) ❌ Right: さんぼん ✓ Wrong: いちほん (1) ❌ Right: いっぽん ✓ Wrong: ろくほん (6) ❌ Right: ろっぽん ✓ Wrong: じゅうほん (10) ❌ Right: じゅっぽん ✓

children.heading: Mistake 1: Wrong sound changes
children.content: Wrong: いちほん ❌ Right: いっぽん ✓ "1 (long object)"

children.heading: Mistake 2: Using 本 for books
children.content: Wrong: 本を3本読みました ❌ Right: 本を3冊読みました ✓ "I read 3 books" 本 as counter = long objects 本 as noun = book

children.heading: Mistake 3: Confusing with 2 本 (nihon = Japan)
children.content: 2本 (にほん) = 2 long objects 日本 (にほん) = Japan Context makes it clear!

children.heading: Mistake 4: Wrong items
children.content: Wrong: りんご3本 ❌ Right: りんご3個 ✓ "3 apples" (Apples aren't long/cylindrical)

children.heading: Casual
children.content: ペン3本ちょうだい "Give me 3 pens" ビール2本 "2 beers"

children.heading: Polite
children.content: ペンを3本ください "3 pens, please" ビールを2本お願いします "2 beers, please"

children.heading: Formal/Business
children.content: ペンを3本購入いたします "I will purchase 3 pens"

children.heading: Basic
children.content: ペンが3本あります "There are 3 pens" 傘を1本持っています "I have 1 umbrella" 木が10本植えてあります "10 trees are planted"

children.heading: Intermediate
children.content: ビールを何本飲みましたか？ "How many beers did you drink?" 鉛筆を5本買ってきてください "Please buy 5 pencils" この映画は今年見た映画の中で1本目です "This is the first movie I've seen this year"

children.heading: Advanced
children.content: 庭に桜の木を3本植えました "I planted 3 cherry trees in the garden" ワインを2本開けましたが、まだ足りません "We opened 2 bottles of wine, but it's still not enough" 一本ずつ丁寧に説明してください "Please explain each one carefully"

sections.heading: Related Grammar Points
sections.content: Counter System Basics - How counters work Number System Overview - Japanese numbers Sound changes - Phonetic variations 冊 (satsu) - Books counter 個 (ko) - Small objects 本 as noun - Book (different from counter)
